Art. 4.22. 
Exclusion or forfeiture
The surviving spouse may be excluded or deprived in whole or in part of his or her inheritance rights if he or she is deprived in whole or in part of parental authority in respect of the children born of his or her marriage to the deceased.
The action is brought by the descendants in the year following either the opening of the succession or the deprivation of parental authority.
The judgment takes effect on the date on which the action is brought.
If the usufruct has already been converted into full ownership of an asset or into a sum of money or the bare ownership of the assets referred to in Article 4.61, ¤ 7 has been transferred, the exclusion or forfeiture gives rise to compensation.
This compensation is fixed by the court and corresponds to the value of the usufruct, taking into account the probable lifespan of the usufructuary at the date on which the claim is lodged.
 If the usufruct has been converted into a life annuity, the judgment is retroactive to the same date.
